author: Staff Reporter
text:
Collector Veera Raghava Rao affixing his signature during a campaign in Madurai on Monday.— Photo: S. Krishnamoorthy

In an attempt to enlighten the voters of the importance of casting their vote, Collector and District Election Officer K. Veera Raghava Rao launched a signature campaign at the Collectorate on Monday.

While various initiatives like kolam competitions by self-help groups, bicycle rallies and mini-marathon were organised earlier, the district administration has planned to intensify the awareness campaign following the announcement of elections for the Tamil Nadu Assembly.

Inaugurating the campaign on Monday, Mr. Rao made the first signature in the banner tied to the campaign vehicle carrying the pledge: “During the Assembly elections on May 16, without hesitation, I will cast my vote.”

Madurai North constituency was targeted for the campaign on Monday.

The vehicle, which started from the Collectorate, covered Gandhi Memorial Museum, Tamukkam Ground, Zambropuram Market Road, Sellur 60 Feet Road, B.B. Kulam Junction, D.R.O Colony, Surveyor Colony, Mattuthavani, Melamadai Juntion, Gomathipuram and Anna Bus Stand.

Additional Collector and Project Officer, District Rural Development Agency, B. Rohini Ramdas, District Revenue Officer K. Veluchamy and other senior officials also participated in the inauguration. Officials said that the campaign would cover the remaining constituencies in the coming days.
title: Collector launches signature campaign for voter awareness
